Comment: As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)  In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them. Comment: From MassLive's story: Mass. college presidents lead pushback as 100 leaders call out Trump's 'overreach'   "Several Massachusetts college presidents are calling for “one voice” in higher education against “government overreach and political interference,” according to a [Tuesday letter](https://www.aacu.org/newsroom/a-call-for-constructive-engagement) signed by over a hundred higher education leaders.   In an environment where presidents have feared speaking up against the Trump administration, the letter is the first time current presidents have come together in large numbers to express their concerns publicly."  More can be read here: [https://www.masslive.com/education/2025/04/mass-college-presidents-among-the-first-to-publicly-push-back-on-trumps-overreach.html?utm\_medium=social&utm\_source=redditsocial&utm\_campaign=redditor](https://www.masslive.com/education/2025/04/mass-college-presidents-among-the-first-to-publicly-push-back-on-trumps-overreach.html?utm_medium=social&utm_source=redditsocial&utm_campaign=redditor)
Author: MassLive
